page.title: 27HOUSING AND RESIDENTIAL
page.content:
Holdenby remains a relatively exclusive village with median to high property prices. Most of the houses have been modernised. One small in-fill development has been permitted with six mid-range houses constructed in a style consistent with the surrounding residences.

Few major developments have occurred in Spratton in the last fifteen years. Nearly all residential construction has been confined to in-filling and, occasionally, the exploitation of larger gardens. Most frequently developments have been speculative in nature with the result that there remains a severe shortage of affordable housing in the village. Their style ranges from the utilitarian, to 'Town house', to the vernacular. Property prices hover around mid-range levels depending on location and size. A Village Design Statement to serve as a framework for the future infrastructure and building environment of the village is to be submitted to Daventry District Council to provide planning guidelines. The possibility of a Conservation Area is being discussed.
